content:
Diagnosis:		Cecal adenocarcinoma

Management:		15 Jan 2024 Right hemicolectomy

Histology:		pT4aN2a (4/16 nodes), MMR deficient, BRAF V600E mutant

Current situation:	Cycle 4 CAPOX adjuvant chemotherapy

[redacted name] attended the oncology clinic today for pre-cycle review. She has managed the previous cycle well with only grade 1 hand-foot syndrome and mild fatigue. No significant neuropathy reported. Blood tests show stable parameters suitable for continuing treatment. CT scan performed last week shows no evidence of recurrent disease. She continues to gain weight gradually and has now returned to work part-time. The plan is to proceed with cycle 4 CAPOX today as scheduled. We will arrange follow-up CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after completion of planned 6 cycles. Next review in 3 weeks prior to cycle 5.

cancer_timeline.value: CT scan shows no evidence of recurrent disease

patient_facts.value: grade 1 hand-foot syndrome and mild fatigue
blood tests show stable parameters suitable for continuing treatment

status_updates.value: Stage IIIB cecal cancer post right hemicolectomy, tolerating adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy with minimal side effects
grade 1 hand-foot syndrome and mild fatigue, no significant neuropathy
proceeding with cycle 4 CAPOX as scheduled
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after completion of planned 6 cycles
review in 3 weeks prior to cycle 5
